sen.j: 円融院（えんゆういん、天文 (元号)18年（1549年） -没年未詳）は、三浦桃寿丸、宇喜多秀家らの母。
sen.e: Enyuin (1549 - ?) was the mother of Tojumaru MIURA and Hideie UKITA.
Enyuin (1549 - ?) was the mother of Tojumaru MIURA and Hideie UKITA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Enyuin (1549 - year of death unknown) was the mother of Tojumaru MIURA and Hideie UKITA.
sen.cmt: 没年未詳→date of death unknown としました。yearに訂正しました。

sen.j: 三浦貞勝、宇喜多直家に嫁ぎ、一説に豊臣秀吉とは側室的な存在であったとされるが定かではない。
sen.e: She married Sadakatsu MIURA and then Naoie UKITA; some say that she was substantially Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubine, but the fact is unknown.
She married Sadakatsu MIURA and then Naoie UKITA; moreover, some say that she was essentially a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but this hasn't been proved.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She married Sadakatsu MIURA and then Naoie UKITA; however, some say that she was essentially a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but this hasn't been proved.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 確かな史料には尊称としての「大方殿」、院号の「円融院」が知られている。
sen.e: An honorific title "Okatadono" and ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) "Enyuin" appeared in reliable historical material.
An honorific title "Okatadono" and the ingo (a title of respect given to a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) "Enyuin" appear in reliable historical materials.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: An honorific title 'Okatadono' and the a title of respect 'Enyuin' appear in reliable historical materials.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 実名については従来「お鮮」「お福（ふく）」「太万」など諸説があった。
sen.e: Her real names were known as "Osen," "Ofuku," and "Taman."
Her real names were known as "Osen," "Ofuku," and "Taman."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her real name was conventionally known as 'Osen,' 'Ofuku,' and 'Taman.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 「お鮮」は後述する「法鮮」銘五輪塔の法名からの連想で、また「太万」は貴人の母の尊称である「大方」の誤記から生じたものと考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that "Osen" (described later) was associated with a Buddhist name "Hosen" engraved on gorinto (a gravestone composed of five pieces piled up one upon another); and "Taman(太万)" resulted from the typographical error of "Okata(大方)" which was an honorific title given to the mother of a person of high rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that "Osen" (described later) was associated with the Buddhist name "Hosen" engraved on a gorinto (a gravestone composed of five pieces piled up one upon another); and that "Taman (太万)" resulted from the typographical error of "Okata (大方)," which was an honorific title given to the mother of a person of high rank.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is believed that 'Osen' was associated with the Buddhist name 'Hosen' engraved on a below-mentioned gorinto (a gravestone composed of five pieces piled up one upon another); and that 'Taman' (太万) resulted from a slip of the pen of 'Okata' (大方), which was an honorific title given to the mother of a person of high rank.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 残る「お福（ふく）」は文禄２年、朝鮮へ出陣中であった宇喜多秀家の釜山帰陣を報じた豊臣秀吉書状（葉上文書）の宛名が「ふく」であることを根拠とするようである。
sen.e: The last "Ofuku" was supposedly supported by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's letter (Hauemonjo) addressed to "Fuku," notifying that Hideie UKITA, who went into battle in Korea, returned to Busan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The last "Ofuku" was supposedly supported by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's letter (Hauemonjo) addressed to "Fuku," indicating that Hideie UKITA, who went into battle in Korea, had returned to Busan.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The last 'Ofuku' was supposedly based on the Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's letter (Hauemonjo) addressed to 'Fuku,' announcing that Hideie UKITA, who had gone into battle in Korea, returned to Busan in 1593.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: が、宛名がただ「ふく」とのみあることは、書札礼法上からみて秀家の母とするには不審であるとの指摘がなされており、今のところ実名は不明とするほかない。
sen.e: However, some pointed out that only the addressee "Fuku" is not sufficient to assert that "Fuku" was the mother of Hideie, from the rule of writing; accordingly, her real name remains unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, some have pointed out that "Fuku" as the addressee is insufficient proof to assert that "Fuku" was the mother of Hideie, based on the rules of writing; accordingly, her real name remains unknown.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, some have pointed out that 'Fuku' as the address is insufficient proof to assert that 'Fuku' was the mother of Hideie, based on the rules of writing; accordingly, her real name remains unknown.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一説に号とされる「備前殿」の称も確かなものとはいえないようである。
sen.e: Some say that the title of "Bizendono" also has not been confirmed.
Some say the title of "Bizendono" also remains unconfirmed.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Some say the title of 'Bizendono' remains unconfirmed either.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 従来から推測に基づく様々な見解が提出されてきた。
sen.e: With respect to the year of her birth, various views have been shown for years based on the presumption.

sen.e: With respect to the year of her birth, various views have been put forth based on certain presumptions.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: With respect to her year of birth, various views have been put forth based on certain presumptions.

sen.j: しかし近年、吉田兼見の日記「兼見卿記」の記事から天文18年（1549）にほぼ確定したといえる。
sen.e: However, recently the year of her birth has been substantially defined to be 1549 based on the article from "Kanemi kyo ki" (diary of Kanemi) written by Kanemi YOSHIDA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Recently, however, the year of her birth was substantially defined as 1549 based on the article from "Kanemi kyo ki (Diary of Kanemi)" written by Kanemi YOSHIDA.

tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 三浦氏や鷹取氏、船津氏など諸説がある。
sen.e: There are several theories: she was from Miura clan, Takatori clan or Funatsu clan.
It has variously been theorized that she was from the Miura clan, the Takatori clan or the Funatsu clan.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It has been various theories that she was from the Miura clan, the Takatori clan, or the Funatsu clan.

sen.j: 1559年ごろに美作国高田城主、三浦貞勝に嫁いだとされる。
sen.e: It is said that she married Sadakatsu MIURA, the lord of Takada-jo Castle in Mimasaka Province, in about 1559
It is said that she married Sadakatsu MIURA, the lord of Takada-jo Castle in Mimasaka Province, in or about 1559.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: It is said that she married Sadakatsu MIURA, the lord of Takada-jo Castle in Mimasaka Province about 1559.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1565年、夫・貞勝が三村家親に攻められ自刃。
sen.e: In 1565, her husband Sadakatsu killed himself after defeated by Iechika MIMURA.
In 1565, her husband Sadakatsu killed himself after being defeated by Iechika MIMURA.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In 1565, her husband Sadakatsu killed himself when Iechika MIMURA defeated him.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その間に生まれた嫡子・桃寿丸と共に落ち延びたのち、備前国沼城主、宇喜多直家と再婚。
sen.e: She escaped with Tojumaru, a legitimate child born between she and Sadakatsu, and then remarried Naoie UKITA, the lord of Numa-jiro Castle in Bizen Province.
She escaped with Tojumaru, her legitimate child by Sadakatsu, and then remarried Naoie UKITA, the lord of Numa-jiro Castle in Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She escaped the battle with Tojumaru, her legitimate child by Sadakatsu, and then remarried Naoie UKITA, the lord of Numa-jo Castle in Bizen Province.

sen.j: 1572年、のちの五大老の一人となる宇喜多秀家を出産した。
sen.e: In 1572, she gave birth to Hideie UKITA, who later became a member of Gotairo (Council of Five Elders).
In 1572, she gave birth to Hideie UKITA, who ultimately became a member of the Gotairo (Council of Five Elders).
sen.cmt: article

tit.j: 文禄３年の没年および「法鮮尼」の法名について
tit.e: With respect to the year of death: 1594 and a Buddhist name "Hosenni"
Concerning the year of death: 1594 and the Buddhist name "Hosenni"
Concerning the year of death 1594, and the Buddhist name 'Hosenni'
tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 円融院は文禄３年に没し、法鮮尼と呼ばれたとの説が広く普及しているが、これは「法鮮」銘五輪塔（岡山市徳吉町）や某寺の過去帳に法鮮を「宇喜多氏御前」とすることに基づくものである。
sen.e: It is widely believed that Enyuin died in 1594 and was called Hosenni, which is based on the fact that gorinto (in Tokuyoshi-cho, Okayama City) has an inscription "Hosen" engraved thereon and the necrology stored in a certain temple includes the description of Hosen as "Ukita shi gozen."

It is widely believed that Enyuin died in 1594 and was called Hosenni, which is based on the fact that the gorinto (in Tokuyoshi-cho, Okayama City) has the inscription "Hosen" engraved thereon and the necrology stored in a certain temple includes the description of Hosen as "Ukita shi gozen."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is widely believed that Enyuin died in 1594 and was called Hosenni, which is based on the fact that the gravestone composed of five pieces piled up one upon another (Tokuyoshi-cho, Okayama City) has the inscription 'Hosen' engraved and the necrology stored in a certain temple includes the description of Hosen as 'Lady of Ukita clan.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、円融院が慶長５年以降も生存していることは、自筆書状（焼失、備前難波文書）からも以前から明らかになっている。
sen.e: However, it has also been confirmed that Enyuin was alive even after 1600, from her autograph letter (burned and lost; Bizennanba monjo).
However, it has also been confirmed that Enyuin was alive even after 1600, based on her autographed letter (which was subsequently burned and lost; Bizennanba monjo).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, it was also confirmed that Enyuin was alive even after 1600, based on her autographed letter (which was subsequently burned and lost; according to Bizennanba monjo (document on Bizennanba)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: そこで同塔を生前の逆修墓とする見解もあるが、これも当時のイエズス会士の書簡によると、この頃宇喜多左京亮の室が岡山で病死したとあり、時期や「宇喜多氏御前」との名義から、この人物に比定するのが妥当との見解が近年出されるに至っている。
sen.e: One theory is that gorinto was her gyakushubaka (a grave established before he/she dies) established before death; another theory is that the letter of the Society of Jesus at that time put: the wife of Ukita sakyo no suke (Assistant Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) died of disease in Okayama in those days; a more recent theory is that it is appropriate to identify that Enyuin is identical to Hosenni based on the time of her death and the name "Ukita shi gozen."

One theory is that the gorinto was her gyakushubaka (a grave established before one's death), while another theory is that the letter of the Society of Jesus at that time stated that the wife of Ukita sakyo no suke (Assistant Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) died of disease in Okayama in that period; however, a more recent theory is that it is appropriate to assert that Enyuin is identical to Hosenni based on the time of her death and the name "Ukita shi gozen."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: One theory is that the gravestone composed of five pieces was her grave established before one's death, while another theory is that the letter of the Society of Jesus at that time stated that the wife of Ukita Assistant Master of the Eastern Capital Offices died of disease in Okayama in that period; consequently, a more recent theory is that it is appropriate to assert that Hosenni is this woman based on the time of her death and the name 'Lady of Ukita clan.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
